meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being impure.
meanings.sent1: The impurity of the water made it unsafe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the impurity of the sample under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The impurity in the chocolate was discovered when it turned out too bitter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness shone through the impurity of her words.
meanings.sent5: The impurity of the air in the factory was visible as dark smoke.

meanings.definition: Something that is impure or contaminated.
meanings.sent1: The impurity in the food caused the outbreak of illness.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler carefully removed every impurity from the diamond.
meanings.sent3: The impurity in the soil made the plants grow in strange shapes.
meanings.sent4: His impurity of thought led to questionable decisions.
meanings.sent5: The impurity of the gold was evident in its dull shine.

meanings.definition: The presence of foreign substances or elements in a material.
meanings.sent1: The impurity in the metal affected its strength and durability.
meanings.sent2: The impurity of the air pollution was a major concern for the city.
meanings.sent3: The impurity in the paint caused it to peel off the walls.
meanings.sent4: The impurity of the data led to inaccurate results.
meanings.sent5: The impurity of the oil caused the engine to malfunction.
